subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The Yankees right-hander Jeff Karstens pitched three and a third scoreless innings yesterday in his first minor league rehabilitation start since breaking his right leg two months ago.Karstens allowed three hits, one walk and struck out two in a Gulf Coast League game against Philadelphia minor leaguers. He is scheduled to join Class A Staten Island for his next start.Karstens was hurt April 28 in a game against Boston. On his first pitch, he was hit on the side of his knee by Julio Lugo’s line drive.The right-hander Phil Hughes, who has been sidelined since May 1 by ankle and hamstring injuries, is scheduled to make his first rehabilitation start Monday for Class A Tampa.
